Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL
Name: Pitcher
Description: Pitcher with narrow mouth, rounded rim and moulded lip, short neck with convex walls and stable base with ring-shaped foot, rectangular in cross-section. It has a small ribbon handle which starts at the moulding and ends in the upper third of the body. Orangey-coloured paste. Surface covered with a reddish-coloured coating, partially lost.
